content:
Ladies and gentlemen, my esteemed opponent may argue that the response given may be irrelevant to the conversation at hand. However, I would like to point out that it is precisely the unexpected nature of this response that makes it engaging. It takes the conversation in a completely different direction, and keeps the other person on their toes. 

Furthermore, the response also includes two interesting pieces of information - a Lady Gaga white blood drive and a jazz concert hosted by the president of Spotify. These pieces of information are not only engaging, but they also have the potential to spark further conversation and discovery. 

In conclusion, the response given may seem random, but that is precisely what makes it engaging. It provides unexpected information and takes the conversation in a new direction, while also providing interesting tidbits that could lead to further discussion. Thank you.

: I respectfully disagree with my opponent's argument. While it is true that unexpected responses can sometimes be engaging, this particular response is not engaging in a positive way. It completely derails the conversation and takes it in a direction that has nothing to do with the previous topic. 

Moreover, the two pieces of information included in the response are completely unrelated to each other and to the current conversation. The Lady Gaga white blood drive and the jazz concert hosted by the president of Spotify have nothing to do with animated movies, DC, or crab soup. 

Therefore, this response not only fails to be engaging in a positive way, but it also disrupts the flow of the conversation and makes it difficult to continue. It does not contribute anything meaningful or relevant to the discussion. 

In conclusion, this response is not engaging, but rather a distraction from the current topic. It fails to provide any value to the conversation and makes it difficult to continue in a meaningful way. Thank you.

Both sides have presented their arguments regarding the engagingness of the given response. The affirmative side argues that the unexpected nature of the response makes it engaging, and the two pieces of information provided have the potential to spark further conversation. On the other hand, the negative side argues that the response completely derails the conversation and fails to contribute anything relevant or meaningful. 

Based on the arguments presented, the winner of the debate is the negative side. While unexpected responses can sometimes be engaging, the given response fails to contribute anything relevant to the conversation and disrupts the flow of the discussion. The negative side effectively argues that the response is a distraction and does not provide any value to the conversation. Therefore, the negative side wins the debate.

topic_chat_history:
so , i 'm reading the latest film from studio ghibli is out the tale of princess kaguya . dunno if you 're familiar with them , but studio ghibli has made a lot of great animated films , like spirited away , and princess mononoke 
 i do n't think i have heard of them . i have heard that one of the directors recently passed away , and his last film was nominated for an academy award 
 yeah , sadly , disney ( which owns the american rights to the films ) does n't tend to promote them very much . i think they 're worried they 'll cut into their " home grown " market . anyway , dunno if you even like animated movies , but they 're worth checking out . 
 i do n't watch them very often . apparently there was a showing of the recent film in a park in d.c . that 's one u.s . city i have n't been to 
 sadly , i have n't been to dc either , although i 've always wanted to visit there . apparently there 's a lot of interesting going down this summer . they 're having a crab feast at the navy - marine corps stadium . they 'll have 100 gallons of crab soup ! can you imagine that much soup ?
topic_chat_fact: from left , emma baker , daniel saperstein and taylor mulitz of flasher will perform this summer 's final fort reno concert . ( jared soares for the washington post ) monday , july 30 25th birthday celebration at national postal museum : celebrate 25 years of this institution devoted to the long history of the u.s . postal service with daytime festivities that include cupcakes , birthday postcards , a photo booth and a special scavenger hunt with prizes . 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. free . tuesday , july 31 " the color purple " at kennedy center : the tony award - winning musical revival , based on the pulitzer prize - winning alice walker novel of the same name , features jazz , ragtime , gospel and blues with a story about an african american woman named celie surviving poverty in the south during the 1930s . through aug . 26 . $ 69-$149 . ask a harry potter scholar at southeast neighborhood library : come to this talk from tolanda henderson , a librarian from george washington university , who has used the j.k . rowling book series as a text in academia . commune with other muggles who prove that it 's not just kids and young adults who obsess about the boy who lived . 7 p.m. free . wednesday , aug . 1 rico nasty at the fillmore silver spring : two summers ago , rico nasty was a teenage loudmouth from the maryland suburbs , generating buzz on youtube for spitting surly , rainbow - tinted rhymes . now , after signing a deal with atlantic records , the 21-year - old singer is on her way to becoming one of the brightest voices in rap music .
topic_chat_response: i have n't but i have heard that a lady gaga has a white blood drive . i think it 's interesting that the president of spotify has a jazz concert .
